content.description:
This is the offwidth climb directly to the left of

Lickedy Split

.  Surmout a tough roof and up through an "easier" OW crack.  It is a great place to set a TR and practice offwidth techniques!
content.protection: #4 Camalot and smaller.  Or walk up the trail and TR.
content.location:
This is 10 feet to the left of

Lickedy Split

in an alcove.

content.description:
Time Bandit is the bolted line to the right of "

Edge of Time

".  It has a slightly awkward start, then it eases off a bit until you reach the proper crux about at about 40' which follows a bolt to the right through a polished section of rock.  I found the line to be a bit contrived, as a more natural weakness presents itself to the left to avoid the crux and meet up with the

Edge of Time

anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts and 1 piton to a 2-bolt anchor.

content.description: A bouldery start right off the ground will feel much harder than 10a if you're shorter than 5'9" or 5'10" and can't reach the good starting holds.  After you're established on the slab above the first bolt fun, easy climbing leads to good moves on the slab arete above.
content.location: The climb starts on the right of where the trail meets the upper part of Classy Cliff.

content.description: Palming Baby Heads is a great challenge that tackles the tallest part of this cliff. It climbs the flaring crack on the right side of Classy Cliff proper. After the first 2 bolts, use all of your body tension to keep you from swinging out of the flaring crack. The hardest moves are at the top of the crack getting established on the slopey ledge. A good rest here is welcomed relief before embarking on steep, blocky climbing past a few more bolts to the anchor.
content.location: This is the rightmost sport route on the main face of Classy Cliff. Look for the bolt line that follows the flaring crack.

content.description: The crux is off the ground, to fun jams!
content.protection: 1-3 in gear, and maybe a couple small cams.
content.location: Is located in the middle of the main wall.

content.description: This is a mixed route of slab climbing, broken in half by a dirty, ledgy section about halfway up. The start is difficult and the crux is probably 3/4 of the way up for a couple moves on very thin holds.
content.protection: A #0.75 cam, a small Alien, plus 3 bolts.
content.location:
This is the leftmost route on the smaller, setback face that holds 4 routes on the right side of the classy cliff face. It's uphill and right of

Time Bandit

and left of

Slice of Lime

.

content.description: This is an easy climb with some hand/finger crack.
content.location: This is to the right and slightly back from the Classy Cliff when viewed from the road. This route is the furthest to the right before there's no rock (and even further to the right is the Master Headwall).

content.description:
This is a great pitch to the right of

Arching

/

Dawson's Crack

. Start in a wide, crack feature working up on good holds to a scrunched stance near an old pin. A #0.75 works well to protect the crux. Work up on sloped, blind pockets and stemming to a reachy hand jam and more protection up and left. Move up and left with cool, steep movements and back right to grovel finish or tricky sequence if you want to make it look stylish.
Climb the right side of the arete. It is a pretty sand bagged 5.9, but it is fun. The crux is probably the last 10 feet.
content.location: It's the second to farthest route right on the main wall of Classy Cliff, on the arete.

content.description:
Start in a corner to the first bolt. Set up for a big reach left onto the face, then follow slopers up and left to stance on edge of

Gargoyle

. Shake it out, and move back right into bouldery crux moves. Follow the direct finish a few moves on a steep face or make a thin sequence right into pricker brush traverse.
content.location: It is the first bolted route to the right of the cracks.

content.description:
Climb directly up the flaring, wide crack using a multitude of chimney/offwidth techniques.  This shares anchors with

Arching Connection

.
content.protection: Large cams, tolerance for pain, bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the right of two crack systems connected by an arching crack at about 25 feet.  The left crack is

Arching Connection

.

content.description:
Start in a wide crack that narrows down to hands.  Cop a good rest if needed before busting right along the arching crack (crux) to connect with and finish on

Dawson's Crack

.
content.protection: Single set of cams; long runners.  Bolt anchor.
content.location:
Start just to the right of

Matata

on the left of two crack systems connected by an arching crack at about 25 feet.

content.description: Start in a short, left-facing corner to a small ledge with the first bolt.  Run it out on easy climbing to the bolt or place a #2 Camalot.  From here, small crimps and bouldery moves lead to a good, horizontal break (Pricker Bush Traverse).  Continue up and right across the slab on some cryptic climbing to easier and steeper climbing above to the anchor.
content.location: This is the middle bolted route on the right side of the main face of Classy Cliff.  Start in the short (kind of dirty), left-facing corner.
